comment: Dr. Wright is a caring professor. The course material consists of sooo many written responses. A few essays throughout the semester. I enjoyed him as a professor however I ended the course with 88 average. Honestly, I don't know what I could have done differently to earn an A.

If you have the opportunity to take Professor Wright, do it! By far my favorite professor that I have had at Kennesaw. I took him a year ago and I wanted to come back to encourage other students to take him as well. Mr. Wright is extremely accommodating and understanding, his lectures are also very interesting. He provides great feedback.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Wright is very laid back and easy to talk to, however for those who need excessive detail or struggle with too much leeway his class can be difficult to pass. I did pretty well but I disliked the minimal instructions despite encouragement that I'll do well. Thank you for an easy-ish semester haha.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: The class was easy with few assignments and I did not have a problem with him until the end of the semester. We had a research project and I had questions about my grade and he never answered me. I sent him two emails and gave him plenty of time before grades were due. He put my final grade in and still has yet to get back to me...
Great! He makes it his duty to remember all students names and not like we're just a number. You'll pass if you pay attention. Class is relatively easy and gives god feedback on papers.

I liked taking Professor Wright's class, it was relatively easy for someone who doesn't like history that much. The midterm and final were super easy if you pay attention and take good notes in class. Attendance is worth 10% of your grade so make sure you don't miss more than the three days he gives of the excused absences for the semester.

Attendance is 10% of your grade so make sure you go to class. He is very generous with due dates, as long as you ask. You'll do quite a bit of writing because that's how every assignment (including exams) is set up. Everything is open note so it's hard not to do well in this class. Just take good notes!

This class was great in terms of lectures were nice and discussion posts were great as well. The big issue I have is that he only has 4 assignments and the exams are in a word doc which is great but doesn't provide any feedback and grades last minute so you can't improve for the next assignment, which is a shame cause I really liked this professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Very caring professor! Did an amazing job at introducing the course information, and was focused more on students learning than just doing busy work. He took time to read the written assignments and provide very good feedback. Would recommend taking his courses!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Wright is super accommodating with deadlines which I really appreciate. His online class was super organized and clear. There was a lot of reading and writing, as to be expected with an online history class, but it wasn't hard. Really nice guy!

This class is super boring, and i LOVE history. I barely went to class. This Prof is SO nice tho. He cares about each student & communication was a breeze. Couple essays, weekly 2 paragraph reading summary/discussion. Use notes/book on everything. Easy A, pls take him!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Wright is willing to work with you and is understanding about deadlines. His lectures are interesting and there are few graded assignments. No quizzes but short responses/essays instead. Take notes, attend class, and you will be set!

I took this class during the summer, an 8-week course. Professor Wright was super caring about his students and made the class super easy. Tbh I didn't pay that much attention and passed. He was very lenient with deadlines. Kinda slow with responding to emails and grading but overall an amazing professor and I would 10/10 take a class of his again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Wright is an amazing teacher if you're looking to take History 1112. He is extremely nice and caring about how you do in class, and is a good grader. Attendance is mandatory, but lectures aren't draining. Write/Type down everything on PowerPoints and you'll do 100% on test. He is writing heavy but he's given the class 2 week extensions. TAKE!

Pf. Wright was a good guy, however not so much as teaching. For a history class it is extremely writing based. All the homework is writing essays, which he grades hard. He is very nice about deadlines but make sure it is a good written paper, even for a history class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He mainly lectures most of the time. All of the assignments are written. There are five reading responses (two paragraph summary of the textbook chapter), two analytical essays (five pages each D:), one midterm, and one final. He is a very lenient grader and is always willing to give extensions. The class is extremely writing based.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Prof Wright was a super kind teacher, he just didn't really teach. However, he is an extremely easy grader and he is lenient with deadlines. If you feel you need more time, he is more than willing to give it to you. You have 5 reading responses (2 paragraphs each), two essays, and a midterm and final. LOTS of writing, but again, easy grader
